intro: Sessea confertiflora, commonly known as the dense-flowered sessea, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its clustered, small, white to pink flowers that bloom in dense inflorescences. Its leaves are typically opposite and have a leathery texture with a prominent midrib. Sessea confertiflora is often found in moist, shaded habitats such as forest understories.
